content.text:
# Timeline of the Finnish War

This is a timeline of battles and other events of the Finnish War (1808–1809). The dates are according to the Gregorian (Western European) calendar. Russian sources might refer to Julian calendar dates.
{| class=wikitable
|-
!Date
!width=30%|Event
!Location
!Coordinates
|-
|align=right|February 21, 1808 (c. 5:00 a.m)
|Russian army crosses the border to Finland
|Kymi river, border river, near Hamina.
|?
|-
|align=right|March/April, 1808
|Russian army
|Kuopio, Tampere, Jakobstad
|?
|-
|align=right|March/April, 1808
|Russian navy
|Gotland, Åland
|?
|-
|align=right|March 18, 1808
|The Russian army conquers the Fortress of Svartholm||Loviisa
|?
|-
|align=right|March 21, 1808
|The Russian army conquers the Hanko Peninsula
|
|?
|-
|align=right|March 22, 1808
|The Russian army conquers Turku
|
|?
|-
|align=right|April 6, 1808
|Cronstedt, who is the commander of the Fortress of Sveaborg, negotiates with the Russian army
|
|?

|Pyhäjoki

|Battle of Kumlinge
|
|?

|
|?

|?
